title: 107_hr2546
content: The Act titled "Real Interstate Driver Equity Act of 2002" regulates interstate pre-arranged ground transportation services. The Real Interstate Driver Equity Act of 2002 amends Section 14501 of title 49, United States Code, to prohibit states from requiring a license or fee for pre-arranged ground transportation services if certain conditions are met. The Real Interstate Driver Equity Act of 2002 amends Section 14501 of title 49, United States Code to prohibit states from requiring a license or fee for pre-arranged ground transportation services under specific conditions. The act defines intermediate stops as pauses during transportation for passengers to engage in personal or business activities, provided the driver does not resume transportation until after the activity. The Real Interstate Driver Equity Act of 2002 prohibits states from regulating taxicab services or restricting airport operators from contracting with ground transportation providers. It also allows states to require pre-licensing for individuals operating prearranged ground transportation services. The Real Interstate Driver Equity Act of 2002 allows states to require pre-licensing for individuals providing ground transportation services, including drug testing and criminal background checks. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS. In section 13102 of title 49, United States Code, amendments are made to include definitions for "pre-arranged ground transportation service" and "taxicab service." The former refers to transportation arranged in advance for up to 15 passengers, while the latter is defined as passenger transportation in a motor vehicle. Passenger transportation in a motor vehicle with a capacity of up to 8 passengers, not on a regular route or between specified places, licensed as a taxicab by a State or local jurisdiction, or provided by a person offering local transportation primarily based on distance traveled, excluding transportation to or from airports. Amendments made to include taxicab service as a motor carrier transportation. Amendment to include taxicab service as a form of minimum financial responsibility for passenger transportation in motor vehicles.
